intro: Lobelia anceps var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Its foliage is generally dark green with a slightly hairy texture, adding visual interest to the landscape.
